titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Margaret Smith, Judgment
CWG0923

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Apprehension of Fugitives from Justice Papers, 1863-1867

body.p: The following is a true copy of the verdict of the Jury in the case of the Commonwealth of Ky against Margaret Smith indicted for Grand Larceny. viz

We of the Jury find the prisoner named in the within Indictment, guilty, and she shall be confined in the Jail and Penitentiary House of this Commonwealth One year, and recommend her to the clemency of his Excelency the Govenor

John Price foreman
att James P Chambers C J C C
The accused is a young woman with a child two years old she was charged with the Larceny of fourteen yards of green Berage worth sixty-five cents per yard

Jefferson Cir Ct
vs
Pardon granted
Thos E Bramlette
Margaret Smith
One year
Grand Larceny
18th May/ 64
